This isnt a post about anything other then X3, im writting it so i can come back and look at it when needed

Ive bin so wound up on the whole deadpool theory i decided to calm down and read the novel X3 (The one based on the movie), and after reading it some of the death scenes actually make a lot of sence since we never really got to actually see "scott die", so i looked up what happend to him and heres what was said:

(About Logan) The metal provided an anchor for his physical being and at the same time, the outrush of power from her acted as an amplifier for his own abilities. He hadn't seen Scott die, but he could guess what happened. She amplified his optic blasts, so much that he damn near shattered an entire mountain, but all that really did was complete the energy loop back to her. Blasting at her actually made her stronger, meanwhile Scott had no defense against the discorporation process. Same with Xavier. His telepathy must have been heightened to an unimaginable extend, but even if it put him on a level above her, he could not match her telekinetic powers and he couldn't repair the damage she was doing to him. 

Logan, of course, was another critter altogether. 

The harder she hit him, the more efficiently his body healed. She couldn't kill him, only make him stronger. If she really wanted him gone, there were ways to accomplish it. Throw him away for instance; he had no doubt, at her level, she could put him into orbit with a thought. If he was still here, it was for a reason

Even tho i cant sleep im in a very good mood so i thought id talk here and tell everyone (even tho most people on here wud know) about whats bin going down. No idea where to start, and i dont wanna talk about it a lot as i would be here all day, but my trips to Germany, Amsterdam and the Cezch Republic were simply an amazing experience, i thought i wouldn never get a chance to "tour" around bits of europe, but i did and i met some new friends along the way, Xutan, Kim, Sharah and many more i keep in contact with, its just great hearing about other peoples stories, and people who actually want to get to know me (for a change) lol. Prague in my opinion was "ok", Amsterdam i can only describe as "Amsterdam", if you have bin before you know what i mean, and Berlin is a city you must see before you die, its great fun, pictures and videos only tell like maybe 1/8 of the story i had, i havent botherd to tell many people about it that much unless they asked things, that way i know that there genrally interested.

Went to see Bolt which is great!, hes soo cute!, i really cant remember anything else ive seen, OO, that new clint eastwood film aswell, that was amazing!, hes still got it ;), um today i watched bits of a copy of the watchman and its exactly what i expected really, very camp and full of sex, so i missed half of it through bordem then watched the last few bits since me bro in-law insisted, but why wud i wanna watch a naked blue guy doing rape lol? i know it was as 18 but jesus man. I really cnt think of any other films ive seen ive bin that busy, but there is this one film...

..called X-men origins: Wolverine im looking foward too :D, just been watching X2 aswell and for people to say that as "basicaly a wolverine movie anyway" is bullshit, he has about much screen time as magneto and jean grey, if not less. People always say i get far too exited over these movies too, or any marvel movie, all i can say is sorry for being a fan? if you dont like what makes me happy, fuck off :), not my fault FOX, Sony, Marvel etc decided to make movies about my fav comics books since i was a kid. Anyway where was i, i had already read Wolverine: Origins, so i have an idea how the movie will pan out, exept with the introduction of Gambit and Cyclops!!, they have nailed Gambit down to a fucking T, and he even has the accent!. I guess FOX finally thought "okay, we get your point people you wanna see gambit, here he is", rather than waiting for X-Men: First class or another movie to be made where he still wouldnt really fit in, but from what ive seen so far he fits in here, just hes gonna be older than cyclops if they make any movies with him in past X3 :P. Also im looking foward to the DVD already, it didnt really work being a wolverine movie but Wayde Wilson (deadpool) broke the 4th wall apparently (which is where he turns to the audience and makes comic remarks as he knows hes a comic book character) on a few outtakes and they were gonna leave 1 in but obv it just didnt work as your really not meant to crack up in a wolverine movie lmao, so bring on the deadpool movie if thats what FOX is thinking of doing. 

Btw if nobody knows what deadpool is like about breaking the 4th wall, this is a good example, NO it has nothing to do with the new wolverine movie, its just some dude doing an amature movie acting out what hes like called "deadpools day out", its fucking hilerious, he takes a funny dig at luke cage too :P,  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FujVOhVVzUM and after the credits it isnt finished!

So i have that to look Foward too, Glasgow in 2 weeks, where im getting dragged to see Mall Cop which looks really funny, plus going to pics with fee is always a laugh anyway, we really shouldnt be allowed to go. Its an idea anyway, but at the same time i wanna go to Wolverhampton for Wolves last game of the season, so i dunno what im doing, but nothing wrong with having a few ideas in me head.

Im up far too early, so ive decided to have a bit of a rant. Not that much as gone on life, but ive had quite an interesting social life lately lol. 

Went to see "the wrestler", which is one of my new fav movies, maybe just because im a huge wrestling fan, but more so as it was so real, people really dont reilise what them people go through and how it really isnt all that fake, shit does happen, not matter what you do for a living. So i really enjoyed it as i thought i would have. And seen valkyrie too, that was great!.

Bin told theres about a 15% chance of me going to the arctic for 10 weeks for like a global warming research trip!, but the training for it takes place when im away in Germany, so ive bin told i need to go up today and find out if they can train me seperatley. If i can go tho, ill be giving the whole world a big "fuck you" :P, but i aint getting my hopes up, but still cant wait for Germany/Amsterdam now like, a lot of people (mainly women :P) think im "brave" going alone, when really its not difficult, even when i get "lost", how can i be lost if i dunno where the fuck i am anyway? i cant be lost in a place i dont even know, so its just a giant adventure, and how can i afford it with no job? with great difficulty, but when i put my mind to something about 90% of the time ill make sure ill go through with it, otherwise whats the point in having ideas?. It seems like everyone i know to wants to go to Amsterdam aswell, ive bin before like, and im going again :P, im gonna state the obvuious here but its just a cheap place to get drunk/stoned, to me its not that special, thats why i turned down fee to go in Jan (even tho she didnt go anyway lol), as it wud have just bin me, her and a few of her mates, i would go off to explore Holland, and they wud godo there thing, so maybe im starting to figure out that going alone to places is probabaly for the best, lord knows ive asked enough people to do shit.

Gonna start learing to ride a motorbike/scooter soon too hopefully, obv i dont want a scooter, but you have to start off on the smaller engines i guess, lessons take place in gateshead so it aint too far. Me on a bike doesnt sound that safe to be fair, but it beats driving a car anyday.

Um nowt else really, said i was gonna rant and i did.

Anyway thats about it, i think i might be geting credit soon since im gonna need it, ive seem to found a few people these days who actually do text, even tho they are at work and text me when im watching me neighbours!, but still, ill let them off because there nice. X-MEN ORIGINS: WOLVERINE, looks fucking amazing, but i believe i already spoke about this already sumwhere, but i dont care, it looks a lot darker than your typical x-men film, not dark as the dark knight (haha), but just as dark as you would exept it to be. Plus i dont get how people moaned about not having gambit movies, and some people are now moaning hes in this!, you just cant win lol, the x-men movies are just a different take on the comics, like different drafts get mixed together, and gambit does have a history with wolverine anyway, and from the look of the trailer it looks like he has a decent part. The only character i feel they shud have never used yet in ANY marvel movie would be venom, he had sooo much potential! but he sufferd the fate gambit WOULD have sufferd if he was in X-men 3, id rather have gambit in a decent role, then just give him the venom treatment. I remember when i had to be up at 4am to walk a few miles and get the bus at 5am to go to Banff when i was in Canada, and i was up at 2 so i think my trains usually leave at 6am from Berlin, so getting up shouldnt be a problem, im always too exited to sleep anyway :P, i remember thinking when i was walking the streets of Calgary, you could see the rockies in the distance, and i said to meself "ill go there tomorrow", and i did, if theres one thing i like about me its quite often if i say ill do summit, i will, i hate being pulled back, i almost didnt go away at all because of money issues, and i still technicaly cant go way!, im just ploding along, as its now booked and once i get on that plane, that week is mine, all mine :D, yeah okay i do want people to cmoe along, but as i said before, i hate being pulled back so whatever lol. Im gonna get lost too, i did in Canada for quite a while, and it was great meeting new people, like, outside Calagry, so now im all exited about going away again, but worried, again, trying to contact people before i went away was a nightmare, like nobody eevr cared lol, and even when i came back i think only fee rang me up to see if i got home okay. I could turn this into a rant now but im too happy :), Germany, here i come :D, Itl be like, in 2 years and 4 months, ive been to Canada, France, Germany, Amsterdam, Poland and Cech Republic, and for living on EMA and random bonus's, I even remember from Jan-May 2006, i spent nothing on myself or anyone else!, it all went into Canada, if you wanna go sumwhere, you easily can, just have to stop worrying about whats in front of you, because the people that know me, know i worry all the time about the future, but sumtimes theres no point to it, id much rather spend my money on exploring places ive never been to, and thats what i intend to do in my future :)

Just thought id do a blog on "Chinese Democracy" fuckers!!, haha, i love laughing at the doubters :P, so yeah, if you dont like guns nd roses, or axl rose, no point in reading from here. My faith in rock music has been restored, been listennig to country/folk and the usual stuff froms the 80s, but now i can relax knowing ive been saved, finaly, sumthing from the 2000's which is worth listening to, rock wise.

Chinese democracy - Good opening to an album, stright to the point rock/grunge type song.

Shackler's Revenge - Very different rock song from what were used to hearing, and thats great!, which makes for a great song, can see people hating this one just because "its not the real guns n roses", get over yourselves, this is a damn good rock song

Better - Possibly the most catchiest song on the album, its like 15 years all of rock music, compresed into 1 song. Very raw!.

Street of dreams - November rain meets queen here. Fucking amazing this song, cud have eben a tad longer, but its the quality, not quantity

If the world - Spanish guitars eh? not sumthing id thought id hear axl try, but he pulls it off, takes a while for you to being to reilise whats going on in the song, but its worth it.

There was a time - One of the best songs on the album. Solos are just fantastic, slash who? :P, ok so i still do love slash, but this is the type of song which justifies axl being the brains behind the band all along.

Catcher in the rye - Another queen type of song, but more edgy, i love it. Its just immense how the whole song builds up, its a nice surprise this song.

Scraped - The usual grity dirty guns n roses type of song. This is the type of song people will feel as if it shud be on a different album, and i agree, but after hearing the whole album, it fits in well with the 71min journey. Great song if you give it time, like "if the world"

Sorry - "almost like doom metal" sabastien bach said, to me, it reminds me of a young david bowie song, but i see what he means with the chorus, such a diferent and unique song, its great!

Raid N' the bedounis - Again your typical guns n roses song, without slash of cause. So sumthing will always be missing on these types of songs, but it maks up for it with axls creativity.

I.R.S - I heard this at download for the first time and i thought "man, this is just amazing, how has the guy made this music and nobodys thought of it", like i said back then, its one of those songs that will be stuck in your head for ages, and you wonder why nobody came up with it before, guess they aint called axl rose thats why :P

Madagascar - Most peoples fav from all the "leaked tracks", even tho it was only a demo, the song must have been remixed again like with "street of dreams", how the fuck can axl improve a fucking amazing song is beyond me!

This i Love - (no pun intended) i love. November rain/Estranged type song again, dunno why the rest of the original band hated doing these songs, this song grips you, and makes you think of what he was thinking when he wrote it, the man has always been a mystery, and long let him be if he comes up with shit like this :D

Prostitute - The name of the song actually means axl not selling himself to us, as its what the song is about, such a powerfull song, and a wonderfull song to close the album.

9.3/10, Guns nd roses will always be my fav band, and axl will always be my fav singer ever, but the only reason this aint a 10 is becasue not of Slash, but Izzy, if izzy had helped axl with the songs, i cant imagine what would have been made. Another 2-3 albums are apparently coming out and sabastian bach has heard most of them, basatrd lol, but he says "This is just the begining", and i second that, bring it on, the god of rock is back, like it or not!

People will hear music this year," says Axl Rose, puffing on a cigar in the early hours of Saturday morning at the Hollywood Forever Cemetery. 
The notoriously reclusive rocker is of course referring to Guns n' Roses' decade-in-the-making Chinese Democracy, arguably the most anticipated album in rock & roll history. "It's a very complex record," says Rose, a surprise guest at Korn's tour announcement bash. (Others in the house: Jessica Alba, cast members of The OC, and members of Linkin Park, Good Charlotte and the Used.) "I'm trying to do something different. Some of the arrangements are kind of like Queen. Some people are going to say, 'It doesn't sound like Axl Rose, it doesn't sound like Guns n' Roses.'" He then smiles and adds, "But you'll like at least a few songs on there."

Dressed in a Toronto Maple Leafs jersey, cross hanging around his neck, cornrows still intact and sporting a blonde goatee, Rose strolled into the party around 1 a.m., just as the DJ was coincidentally rocking some vintage Gn'R. Approached by a steady stream of women and hard-rock disciples -- including Puddle of Mudd's Wes Scantlin and Papa Roach's Dave Buckner -- Rose is cordial and chatty as he poses for photo after photo. He seems more like an average guy out for a night with friends than the most mythical rock star on the planet in 2006.

And he maintains that that's exactly what he is. "The only time people ever write about me is when I go out to a strip club, because I don't chase the paparazzi down," he says. And, when he's out of the spotlight, Rose says you'll find him doing average-guy stuff: reading books and watching movies. His favorite book is Philip K. Dick's A Scanner Darkly. "I was a little scared when I saw they were making it into a movie starring Keanu [Reeves]," he says. "But I guess if he can handle The Matrix, he can do this."

While Rose and his revolving cast of Gn'R bandmates have been working on Chinese Democracy, Papa Roach have achieved platinum status in their own right. But tonight, their drummer reverts to his teenage fan days, asking Rose for a picture and to guest on Papa Roach's next album. Rose strikes a pose and then graciously refers the fellow rocker to his management.

After all, before he lends his talents to others' projects, Rose has one of his own to finish, and he says it's getting there.
